itemDescription: British radio broadcaster and writer on countryside and natural history. Minister of the Methodist Church.

wikipedia_page.main: The Rev. George Bramwell Evens (15 February 1884–20 November 1943) was, under the pseudonym Romany (and sometimes The Tramp), a British radio broadcaster and writer on countryside and natural history matters – quite possibly the first to broadcast on such issues. He was also a Minister of the Methodist Church.
